abstract: A Canadian activist investor who is leading a campaign to agitate for change at RIM, the BlackBerry maker, says he has the support of shareholders representing 8 percent of the company's shares.
snippet: A Canadian activist investor who is leading a campaign to agitate for change at RIM, the BlackBerry maker, says he has the support of shareholders representing 8 percent of the company's shares.
lead_paragraph: The call is growing louder for Research in Motion to explore a sale of all or part of the company.

headline.main: DealBook: Momentum Builds for Breakup of RIM
